Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats such as a playground, garden, forest, parking lot, pond, stream, or lake.
The student can illustrate various living things found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can show comparisons of the diversity of plants and animals in different habitats by labeling them.
The student can recognize and represent patterns in the types of living things across different habitats through observations made firsthand or from media.
